Key Match Events: South Africa edged out Bangladesh by four runs in their T20 World Cup match
Heinrich Klaasen (46) and David Miller (29) took their team past the 100-run mark
Tanzim Hasan Sakib took three wickets for Bangladesh
Keshav Maharaj took two wickets in the final over as Bangladesh could manage only 109/7 in 20 overs
Mahmudullah fell to a huge catch by Aiden Markram off Keshav Maharaj
Jaker Ali was caught by Aiden Markram off Keshav Maharaj
Bangladesh need 11 runs from 6 balls, Keshav Maharaj has one over left
Keshav Maharaj bowled a crucial final over to seal the win for South Africa
Pre-Game Insights: Aiden Markram opted to bat first on a slow, soft pitch
Heinrich Klaasen and David Miller's partnership was crucial for South Africa's total
Bangladesh were reeling at 50/4 at one stage, but Towhid Hridoy and Mahmudullah put on a solid stand of 44 runs
Post-Match Reflections: Heinrich Klaasen is the Player of the Match for his gritty batting performance
Aiden Markram says that everyone was going to be pretty nervous in this sort of a final over finish
Najmul Hossain Shanto says they were nervous but hopeful that Jaker Ali would help win the match
Heinrich Klaasen says that the wicket isn't great for stroke-play, but they had good information from David Miller about the wicket from the last game
Heinrich Klaasen says they have got three games out of the way, winning all of them and will now look forward to the next stage
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa have 6 points in the bag and have a foot in the door for the next round
Bangladesh will be really disappointed as they have let it slip off their palms
South Africa have successfully defended their lowest total
Keshav Maharaj was just good enough to get things done for his team in the final over
South Africa have remained unbeaten in Men's T20Is against Bangladesh
Others: The match was a low-scoring thriller, with South Africa posting 113/6 and Bangladesh managing 109/7 in 20 overs
The Streak remains intact! It's 9-0 to South Africa in T20s and Bangladesh have to wait a little longer to get better of the Proteas
